marketNews.title: IHSG drops -3.4% marking worst daily decline since May 2022
marketNews.content: IHSG fell -3.4% on Monday (5/8), marking the worst daily decline since May 2022, following negative sentiment from macroeconomic and global financial markets. The decline was driven by rising concerns of a US recession after the release of July 2024 employment data that was much worse than expectations, continued correction of US technology stocks after a rally earlier in the year, and a 12.4% drop in Japan's Nikkei 225 index after an unexpected hike in its policy rate. Geopolitical tensions also worsened with the potential for Iranian and Hezbollah retaliation against Israel. All sectoral indices of the IHSG fell today. Out of a total of 895 stocks, 592 weakened and only 62 rose.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Q2 2024 GDP growth
marketNews.content: Indonesia's gross domestic product grew 5.05% year‑on‑year in the second quarter of 2024 (versus 5.11% YoY in 1Q24), beating the consensus level of 5%. Government spending rose only 1.42% YoY, far below the 19.9% YoY increase in 1Q24, while private consumption grew 4.93% YoY (vs 4.91% YoY in 1Q24). On a quarterly basis, the economy expanded 3.79% QoQ, surpassing the consensus of 3.71% QoQ. The first half of 2024 saw a 5.08% YoY growth, slightly below the government target of 5.2% for 2024.

marketNews.title: Potential Iran‑Hizbullah retaliation against Israel
marketNews.content: Axios reported that US Secretary of State Antony Blinken told G7 nations on Sunday (4/8) that an attack by Iran and Hezbollah on Israel could start as early as 1‑2 days later. Iran and Hezbollah have pledged to retaliate for the killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh and Hezbollah commander Fuad Shukr by Israel. Blinken is reportedly urging other foreign ministers to engage diplomatically with Iran, Hezbollah and Israel to prevent a wider conflict.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia cautious on rate cuts
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said the central bank will be cautious in setting the direction of the BI Rate, considering the risk of capital outflows amid high US Treasury yields. He noted that Indonesia's inflation is already within the 1.5‑3.5% target range, but global monetary policy misalignment poses risks. Warjiyo agreed with the consensus that the US Federal Reserve may start cutting rates in September 2024, but emphasized that global risks must be managed before any domestic rate cuts.

marketNews.title: Berkshire Hathaway sells nearly half of Apple stake in 2Q24
marketNews.content: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sold almost half of its Apple holdings during the second quarter of 2024. The stake is now valued at $84.2 billion, down 49% from 1Q24. The sale occurred amid a broader divestment program in which Berkshire disposed of more than $75 billion of equity during 2Q24. Cash and cash equivalents rose from $189 billion at the end of 1Q24 to $277 billion at the end of 2Q24.

marketNews.title: La Nina may affect Indonesian palm oil production
marketNews.content: Indonesia Palm Oil Association (GAPKI) Chairman Eddy Martono said the arrival of La Nina could disrupt the harvesting of fresh fruit bunches (TBS), potentially lowering production. However, he noted that La Nina will not automatically increase palm oil revenues because higher CPO prices from reduced supply may be offset by lower output. BMKG has shifted its La Nina forecast from July to August‑October 2024.

marketNews.title: TEBE interim dividend 2024
marketNews.content: Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 19.3 billion rupiah or 15 rupiah per share. The dividend is payable on the regular market and negotiated market on 12 August 2024, with payment on 26 August 2024. Based on the closing price of 705 rupiah per share on Monday (5/8), the implied dividend yield is 2.1%.

marketNews.title: SMDR realises procurement of 10 vessels by early 3Q24
marketNews.content: Samudera Indonesia (SMDR) CEO Bani M. Mulia said the company has completed the acquisition of 10 vessels by early 3Q24, with capex reaching $100 million out of a total allocation of $280 million. SMDR targets the addition of 12 vessels in 2024.

tickerNews.title: Delta Dunia Makmur and Amman Mineral plan to acquire 92.5% of PSAB
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Technoz reported that Delta Dunia Makmur (DOID) and the Salim Group – through Amman Mineral International (AMMN) – each intend to purchase 92.5% of J Resources Asia Pacific (PSAB) from its controller Jimmy Budiarto in 1Q25. DOID is rumored to bid 300 rupiah per share, while the Salim Group is rumored to bid 350 rupiah per share. DOID director Iwan Fuad Salim said the company refrains from commenting on rumors but does not rule out inorganic expansion opportunities. AMMN chairman Agoes Projosasmito said the company has no acquisition plan. PSAB has not commented on the issue.

tickerNews.title: Mayora Indah revises FY24 sales growth guidance to 10‑12%
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah management revised its FY24 sales growth guidance from high single‑digit to 10‑12% after observing strong domestic sales with double‑digit growth in early 3Q24 and a recovery in export sales. The company also plans to raise product prices for cocoa and coffee in 3Q24 or 4Q24 as commodity prices rise. With the price adjustments, Mayora expects a gross profit margin of at least 25% (vs 23.5% in 1Q24 and 25.8% in 1H24).

tickerNews.title: ACES will not renew license with Ace Hardware, saving royalty fees
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) announced in its earnings call on Monday (5/8) that it will not extend the licensing agreement with Ace Hardware Corporation, which expires on 31 December 2024. Without the license, ACES will not pay the royalty fee of 0.53% of total sales for FY23. However, savings will be offset by higher advertising and promotion costs for rebranding, with FY25 advertising and promotion expected to reach 3% of total sales (vs 1.2% in FY23).

tickerNews.title: Arthakencana Rayatama purchases 25.2 million AKRA shares
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, bought 25.2 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,519.9 rupiah per share between 26 July and 1 August 2024. The transaction value totaled 38.3 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Arthakencana Rayatama's ownership in AKRA increased from 62.4% to 62.53%.

tickerNews.title: Sight Investment announces revised tender schedule for SILO
tickerNews.content: Singapore‑based investment firm Sight Investment Company Ptel. Ltd. announced a change to the voluntary tender offer schedule for approximately 5.9 billion rupiah (45%) of Siloam International Hospitals shares. The new tender period runs from 5 August to 3 September 2024, with payment on 13 September 2024. The tender price remains unchanged at 2,850 rupiah per share, about 10.1% above the average high price in the 90 days prior to the initial information release on 1 July 2024.

tickerNews.title: Temasek and Anderson buy ~1.2 billion MMLP shares via exchangeable bonds
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Mega Manunggal Property, owned by Temasek Holdings (Private) Ltd. and Anderson Investments Pte. Ltd., purchased approximately 1.2 billion MMLP shares from PT Mega Mandiri Properti and West Bridge Developments Limited at a price of 309 rupiah per share on 25 July 2024 as part of the execution of exchangeable bonds. The transaction value was about 368 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Anderson Investments' ownership in MMLP rose from 6.08% to 23.37%.
